ratings.question_text: The readings/cases/textbooks used in this course were __________ .
Out-of-class assignments for this course were ___________ to my learning.
The workload for this course in comparison to other courses was ___________.
The pace of this class was ____________ for optimal learning.
Field trips were well designed and ran smoothly.
I learned a lot from field trips.
How clearly does the instructor provide explanations of conceptual material?
How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-14, if you wish
comments: I wished there was more of an opportunity for discussion earlier in the course--speakers provided interesting perspective (and some sources for debate), but didn't leave much time for us to question our own understanding in discussion with peers.

narratives.question_text: What were the best aspects of this course?
comments: The trip to Haiti was a life-changing, perspective altering experience. I definitely want to go back, and my knowledge of the country has really grown over the course.

The projects we worked on, the trip to Haiti and the work we completed on the ground, the good atmosphere in the class, the friendships we built from working side by side for an entire semester as well as traveling to Haiti for 10 days
The trip to Haiti, and a couple of the guest speakers.

narratives.question_text: What aspects of this course need the most improvement?
comments: Again, wish there was more time to discuss ideas in class. Discussion-based classes at the end of the semester was really helpful.
Better organization of the syllabus, readings better prepared in advance
Classroom sessions were often poorly organized, and lacked any clear continuity. Incorporating more structure and discussion would have helped.

narratives.question_text: Was the relationship between the course lectures and discussion/lab section
comments: They were effective.

narratives.question_text: Discuss, if you wish, how this course fits into your overall program.  (Please feel free to describe how the course relates to your academic background.)
comments: Nothing toshow..

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: I wanted to apply some of the skills I had learned in the classroom in context. I wanted to learn more about the country of Haiti.

To work on a field project in Haiti, as I have been reading/working on Haiti for the past year or so through the course on Managing Global Catastrophes at SOM (with a case study on the Haitian earthquake).
I am interested in international development, and developing countries are often at risk of falling under disaster conditions.
I am interested in sustainable development in Latin America, and was interested in working on a real-world project centered in a very poor Caribbean nation.

narratives.question_text: Did the knowledge/skills that you gained from the course meet your expectations ?
comments: I'd say the knowledge and skills exceeded my expectations--emotional knowledge certainly increased and the class gave me perspectives I didn't have previously.
They did meet my expectations, although I think we could have gained from having more Creole classes.
Yes
Yes
Yes, my expectations were low, so they were met. But I can't say I gained a great deal of knowledge or skills from this course.

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: I loved that the course brought varied professional schools together. We learned from each other in meaningful ways.
Easy communication and division of the tasks, smooth collaboration, everybody got along very well and we all supported each other
Group work was great so we could rely on each other for support, and to get a rounded/varied perspective of the topics discussed and experiences we came across.
Group work is critical to this course. I thought our group worked fairly well together, and taught each other.

narratives.question_text: For students who might consider taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: Take it! I might spend more time trying to learn basic kreyol before the trip and read as much as you can about Haiti before you go.
Only take this course if you are very excited about going to Haiti, are prepared to be proactive in creating a useful project, and are willing to be flexible in class and on the field trip
